intro: Gynura pubigera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or hairy gynura, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Gynura pubigera is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
